overview: Wannier90 is a computational tool used in solid-state physics and materials science to construct maximally localized Wannier functions from Bloch wavefunctions. It allows researchers to analyze and manipulate electronic structures in crystalline materials, enabling a deeper understanding of electronic properties and conducting calculations for various phenomena.
core_features: Generation of maximally localized Wannier functions
Support for electronic structure analysis in crystalline systems
Calculation of transport properties and band structures
Integration with electronic structure calculation packages
